title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 April 2016 - XWiki
content:
has quit 06:04  has joined #xwiki 07:22  has joined #xwiki 07:35  has quit 07:56  has joined #xwiki 08:00  has joined #xwiki 08:48  good morning 08:50  has joined #xwiki 08:56  has joined #xwiki 09:30  Is there anyway I can set table of contents on for all pages by default (even those that are newly created)? 09:31  irctc942: yes it's possible 09:31  you could introduce a custom skin overriding the contentview template for example 09:32  has joined #xwiki 09:33  actually contentvars.vm 09:33  hmmm 09:33  a better way would be to add a rnedering transformation actually 09:33  \*rendering 09:33  has joined #xwiki 09:33  but this requires some java coding 09:34  see http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Transformations and http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Extending#HAddinganewTransformation 09:34  (irctc942) 09:34  alright, I'll check that out, thanks 09:34  another option would be to add a panel containing the toc I guess 09:34  has joined #xwiki 09:35  ie add the toc somewhere other than in the content of the doc 09:35  I'll see if I can try the panel option 09:36  I remember there were some gotchas with that though but can't remember the details 09:36  :) 09:37  found it: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-240 09:38  also found this: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XRENDERING-345 09:39  I had already coded that transformation apparently but it's not been committed AFAIK. I should do that and put in contrib FTM probably 09:40  vmassol: +1 for contrib 09:42  has joined #xwiki 09:48  has quit 09:50  has joined #xwiki 10:02  has joined #xwiki 10:05  has joined #xwiki 10:10  has joined #xwiki 10:14  has joined #xwiki 10:14  has joined #xwiki 10:16  has quit 10:18  has quit 10:22  has quit 10:42  has joined #xwiki 10:57  has joined #xwiki 11:04  has joined #xwiki 11:15  has joined #xwiki 11:31  tmortagne, what are the M- on this channel ? 11:31  vector.im nicks 11:32  vmassol, ok thanks 11:32  vmassol, I'm looking for someone to have a quick look to http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13348 11:32  otp 11:42  has quit 11:43  has quit 11:44  has quit 11:44  has quit 11:48  has joined #xwiki 11:48  has joined #xwiki 11:48  has joined #xwiki 11:50  has joined #xwiki 11:50  has joined #xwiki 11:57  has quit 12:11  has joined #xwiki 12:25  has quit 12:25  has joined #xwiki 12:49  notice about myxwiki.org maintenance for tomorrow: http://markmail.org/message/mljxu4l5cdydfbdo 13:11  has quit 15:02  has quit 15:52  has joined #xwiki 15:52  mflorea: any idea what could cause the GWT build error in http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/2809/console ? I just added missing @Override and removed useless javadocs (at least I think) 15:54  has quit 15:54  added some

too 15:54  is your change valid on java 1.7? 15:55  as I said it's just javadoc stuff 15:55  has quit 15:55  plus @Override 15:55  old stuff 15:55  has joined #xwiki 15:55  has quit 15:55  should even be Java 5 compatible 15:55  GWT does not seems to provide much info on what it did not like 16:00  tmortagne: I don't see anything in the log to explain the problem. I would revert the change and do some binary search to see what change causes the problem 16:04  no sure what you mean by binary search 16:04  mflorea: 16:04  has joined #xwiki 16:06  i.e. do the first half of the changes and see if it fails, then do the other half, etc. 16:07  but in your case I guess you can simply test by replacing the javadoc with @Overrride 16:07  in one place 16:07  @Override was already used before my changes 16:07  so the issue is not about @Override alone 16:09  I just added more of it 16:11  I just reviewed the whole commit and I still can't see any other change that @Override and javadoc 16:12  when I build locally I get more detailed logs 16:13  what do you build with ? 16:13  mvn clean install -Pdev (from xwiki-platform-wysiwyg-war) 16:13  ok lets see what I get then 16:15  The method clone() of type AttachmentReference must override or implement a supertype method 16:16  so it seems to be related to @Override on the clone() method 16:19  looks like GWT does not know about Object#clone()... 16:19  removing it then 16:20  and of course Eclipse complain that I don't have an @Override :) 16:20  :( one more reason to move away from GWT 16:22  the giant error without any information on why it failed was enough for me already :) 16:55  has quit 16:55  has joined #xwiki 17:01  has quit 17:12  has joined #xwiki 17:14  Hi 17:14  hi 17:15  there is an useless branch of forum application and I would like to remove it 17:15  Hello all, long time I havn't come here, sorry :) 17:15  https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-forum/tree/XAFORUM-88 17:15  xwiki\_finstern: hi 17:15  has joined #xwiki 17:15  I hope your work is evolving nicely 17:15  I guess nobody uses it anymore, WDYT? 17:15  you tell us! :) 17:15  ^^ 17:16  you should check out XWiki 7.4.x 17:16  with the new nested pages features :) 17:16  acotiuga: if that issue is closed then I guess it's safe to delete it 17:16  what is it doing vmassol ? 17:17  When you don't understand what is wrong the best is usually to enable debug log to follow step by step what the authenticator is doing. 17:17  See http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Authentication#HEnableLDAPdebuglog. 17:17  xwiki\_finstern: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/ContentOrganization/ 17:17  (a bit hard for me to move on to another version, I don't have access to Internet connexion in my production environment, so I need to upgrade manually ^^) 17:17  but I will try it on my personnal project 17:18  vmassol how can I enable debug ? 17:18  The specific packages to track for LDAP are com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.ldap and com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP. 17:18  when do I need to put that package 17:18  boubou: the doc says it all normally 17:18  sorry can't help you more as I don't use ldap 17:19  vmassol I just want to know how to enable the debug 17:19  and where its logged 17:19  it's indicated on the page .... 17:19  boubou: as vmassol said it's writtten in the link you pasted 17:20  Starting with XWiki 4.2 we added a new Logging UI from the Administration section, which allows logging to be enabled at runtime, directly from the UI, without the need to restart the wiki. 17:20  I bet 17:20  ok... 17:20  oh wow, ok I saw what's this nested page 17:20  nice way to organize your files indeed 17:21  s/files/pages 17:22  anyway, I have a question (yes indeed) 17:22  it's about the livetable macro 17:22  is there a way to list multiple className easily ? 17:23  or do I need to create a JSON and all ? 17:24  has quit 17:24  AFAIK the livetable macro works with a single class 17:24  I tryed to add multiple class in the option 'className' : '.....' , '.....' but it would not work 17:24  ah ok 17:24  but I'm not really an expert 17:25  doc says one class: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Livetable+Macro 17:25  specifically: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Livetable+Macro#HParameter24options 17:25  single class only, so I'm stuck with writing my own json stuff like on the "All Attachments" livetable 17:25  ? 17:25  hmm 17:26  you can check the extraParams property too 17:26  basically, what I'm trying to do is .. 17:26  I have a space for a new "tool" I'm trying to add, in the form of a "checklist" service 17:26  " • Custom xproperty. Find all the documents having objects that have a specific value for a property ("extraParams" : "&yourProperty=yourValue" - note that in this particular case, yourProperty has to be declared in the $columns array). This option can also be used to view properties of classes other than the one declared in className ("extraParams" : "&yourProperty\_class=yourSpace.yourClass" - sorting and filtering available from v 17:26  " 17:27  tmortagne im sorry but its not clear 17:27  boubou: it's very clear for us :) 17:27  Starting with XWiki 4.2 we added a new Logging UI from the Administration section, which allows logging to be enabled at runtime, directly from the UI, without the need to restart the wiki. 17:27   we can't help you if you don't give more details 17:27  because we have ton of administrative actions to check for each single task, sometime it take days .. so we forget something and it's a drama. So adding checklist templates for each task, but now I need to list the documents created with multiples specifics templates 17:27  I cant find it 17:28  when can I enable debug ? 17:28  boubou: you don't know where Administration is ? 17:28  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Logging+Application 17:28  FTR I've just goolged it 17:28  'xwiki log" 17:29  (xwiki logging) 17:29  vmassol: actually this is linked in the line boubou pasted 17:29  OH I need to install that package 17:29  no 17:29  you don't 17:29  "BUNDLED WITH 17:29  " 17:29  so no 17:29  you have this by default 17:29  you just need to go in wiki administration 17:30  thank you for the tip 17:30  np 17:30  XWikiPreferences?editor=globaladmin§ion=Logging 17:30  kkkkk 17:31  thx ;) 17:32  The specific packages to track for LDAP are com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.ldap and com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP is not there 17:32  com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl is here 17:33  tmortagne http://imgur.com/wnbRhvE 17:34  boubou: com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP.XWikiLDAPAuthServiceImpl is a class which is part of the package com.xpn.xwiki.user.impl.LDAP 17:34  you need to enable debug log for all classes in those packages 17:35  http://imgur.com/pWacCSu 17:36  I need to enable debug for all packages, right ? 17:36  boubou: you can't filter everything at the same time 17:36  put only one package in the filter 17:36  enable debug log for all classes in that package then do the other package 17:37  all 7 packages listed http://imgur.com/wnbRhvE ? 17:37  yes 17:39  like that ? 17:39  http://imgur.com/AUf257T 17:39  looks like it 17:39  then where should it be log ? 17:40  google it 17:40  boubou: I can't tell you that, it should end up where the log end up in your application server 17:40  just open google 17:40  and type 17:40  "xwiki log" 17:40  and read 17:41  you're asking  pretty basic questions that should be obvious if you google a bit and read the xwiki.org site 17:41  u are right 17:41  I will read 17:42  im new to xwiki 17:43  has quit 17:43  has joined #xwiki 18:02  has quit 18:12  has quit 18:29  has quit 18:37  has quit 18:39  has quit 19:29  sdumitriu: I'm going to move http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-5852 for 8.1-rc-1 since nobody seems to be working on it and we are supposed to release today 19:35  has quit 19:38  has quit 19:45  has joined #xwiki 19:57  has quit 20:46  has quit 20:56  has joined #xwiki 20:57  Hello chat, I am trying to disable to skin preview url functionality from my instance of xwiki. Could you point me at where in the code I can make the needed modification? 21:00  has joined #xwiki 21:32  has quit 21:46  has joined #xwiki 22:11  hey all, I installed the ldap addons 22:11  where the config in this addon is stored ? 22:12  If I configure the addon, the xwiki.cfg stay unchanged 22:16  has quit 22:20  has quit 22:48  has joined #xwiki 22:49  has quit 22:49  has quit 22:51  What is wrong with that # xwiki.authentication.ldap.user\_group=cn=xwiki\_users,ou=Applications,ou=domain,c=domain,c=qc,c=ca 22:51  my group object is domain.qc.ca/DOMAIN/Applications/xwiki\_users 22:51  has quit 22:53  If I uncomment the line xwiki.authentication.ldap.user\_group, my LDAP stop working 23:07  has joined #xwiki 23:30  has joined #xwiki 23:31  Hello chat! I am trying to disable the skin preview functionality on my instance of xwiki. 23:31  Basically navigating to https://mywiki.com/bin/view/main?skin=colibri should still just take me to my default skin 23:32  any thoughts of where in the code I can disable that particular url parameter 23:54  has quit 23:54  has joined #xwiki
